intro: Chuncoa obovata, commonly known as the broad-ovate chuncoa, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, commonly known as the buckwheat family. The plant is characterized by its oval-shaped leaves and clusters of small, greenish-white flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and lesser-known species within its native range.
